revised_title: Magnetical Observations in the West Indies, North Coast of Brazil, and North America
tldr: This article presents magnetical observations made in the West Indies, North Coast of Brazil, and North America between 1834 and 1837. The author aimed to determine the relative magnetic forces acting on both dipping and horizontal needles at various locations. The results were used to calculate horizontal forces at each place compared to Plymouth, and then converted to whole forces in the direction of the dipping needle. The study provides valuable data for understanding geomagnetism and its applications in navigation and marine science.
